title: 'Arsenal remain in transition with potential after blowing huge opportunity'
description: BBC Sport's Phil McNulty looks at the impact of Arsenal's EFL Cup exit to Liverpool.

title: MOTD Rewind: Danny Welbeck's 'incredible' overhead kick for Watford in July 2020
description: BBC Sport looks back at Danny Welbeck's "incredible" overhead kick for Watford against Norwich in July 2020, as the two sides go head-to-head again in the Premier League this week.

title: Quiz of the week: Could you be the ruler of a remote island?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Gateshead's Kieran Reilly lands 'world's first' BMX triple flair
description: Kieran Reilly says he is the first person to perform three backflips and a 180-degree spin on a bike.

title: Pork pies, curry and pizza - a history of tasty parliamentary plots
description: The "pork pie plot" is just the latest in a long line of attempted Westminster coups.

title: Winter Olympics: medal table - which country has won most golds?
description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.

title: Winter Olympics: Results
description: Results for the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.

title: Brilliant McGrath helps Australia thrash England in Ashes opener
description: England are thrashed in the opening match of the Women's Ashes as Tahlia McGrath fires Australia to a nine-wicket win in the first T20.

title: Ex-Pope Benedict failed to act over abuse, new report finds
description: The former pope is incriminated in a report into the Church's handling of child sex abuse in Munich.

title: Langwith Junction: Murder arrest after couple in 80s attacked at home
description: A man is held on suspicion of murdering Freda Walker, 86, and attempting to murder her husband Ken.

title: Return to the office begins as restrictions axed
description: Business groups broadly welcome end of working-from-home guidance, but there are safety concerns.

title: Boris Johnson's future: Ministers blackmailing plotters, claims Tory MP
description: An MP calling on Boris Johnson to resign says rebels are facing intimidation from government.

title: Ukraine tension: Biden says he thinks Putin will 'move in'
description: The US president warns the Russian leader against invading, but hints at splits among Western allies.

title: Australian Open 2022: Emma Raducanu beaten by Danka Kovinic
description: Emma Raducanu is hampered by a blister on her racquet hand as she is knocked out of the Australian Open by Danka Kovinic.

title: Inflation: Seven reasons the cost of living is going up around the world
description: Global inflation - the rate at which prices rise - is at its highest since 2008. Here are seven reasons why.

title: Subdued Murray beaten in straight sets by Daniel at Australian Open
description: Britain's former world number one Andy Murray produces a subdued display as he loses to Japan's Taro Daniel in the Australian Open second round.

title: Amir Khan: I don't think Kell Brook can take a shot
description: Amir Khan believes Kell Brook's punching power has gone and he can no longer take a shot as the animosity between the pair continues before they meet on 19 February in Manchester.

title: Texas synagogue: Brother urged Texas hostage-taker to surrender
description: Two men are arrested in Birmingham and Manchester as part of the investigation into the attack.

title: Australian Open: Andy Murray opponent Taro Daniel almost hits umpire with wild return
description: Watch as Andy Murray's opponent Taro Daniel hits a wild return that skims the back of the chair umpire during their second round match at the Australian Open.

title: NBA: Watch Joel Embiid's best plays for Philadelphia 76ers
description: Watch Joel Embiid's best plays as he matches his career-high score of 50 points in the Philadelphia 76ers' 123-110 victory over the Orlando Magic.

title: Douglas makes Team GB history as first female summer and winter Olympian
description: Montell Douglas will become the first female British athlete to compete at both the summer and winter Olympic Games after being named in the Team GB bobsleigh squad for Beijing.

title: We are praying for heavy rain - Tonga resident
description: Speaking from Tonga's capital, Nuku'alofa, Marian Kupu gives a firsthand account of the moment the undersea volcano erupted.

title: Tonga: First foreign aid planes arrive bearing crucial supplies
description: It comes after the Pacific nation was left devastated by a volcanic eruption and subsequent tsunami.

title: Tommy Robinson pursued by creditors for an estimated £2m
description: People owed money by the English Defence League founder have appointed an independent insolvency expert.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell seeks retrial in sex abuse case
description: It comes after one of the jurors convicting her of sex abuse charges said he had influenced others.

title: The papers: Johnson fights on but Tory anger builds
description: The latest on the PM's future features on every single one of Thursday's national front pages.

title: Giant pristine coral reef discovered off Tahiti
description: Marine explorers find a "pristine" 3km coral reef at depths of 30m off the coast of Tahiti.

title: A whirlwind dash through Biden's first year in office
description: How did the US president do in his first 12 months in the White House?

title: Apple AirTags - 'A perfect tool for stalking'
description: Apple’s AirTags are great for finding lost items. But they have a darker side.

title: S Africa scientists: Racism at root of Omicron scepticism
description: South African scientists tell the BBC their research should have been taken more seriously.

title: Covid: Did Pfizer's boss cast doubt on his own vaccine?
description: Inaccurate posts about the Pfizer vaccine's protection against Omicron took the drug company's boss out of context.

title: South Georgia: The museum at the end of the world reopens for business
description: On a British island at the edge of the Antarctic is one of the most remote tourist spots in the world.

title: The battle for Steaua Bucharest - an Eastern European giant at war with itself
description: European Cup winners in 1986, Steaua Bucharest's story of decline is unlike any other. A bitter dispute has split the club in two.
